resources.title: How to Use APIs: Cryptocurrency Tracker
resources.description: Build a mini cryptocurrency tracker while applying JavaScript skills and integrating APIs. Learn practical experience in data fetching and application communication, with lessons from expert Mike Dane. Skills gained are transferable to diverse API-driven projects, making this a hands-on, practical learning experience.
learningObjectives: Apply JavaScript skills to build a functional mini-application.
Integrate and interact with external APIs.
Fetch, process, and display dynamic data in an application.
Understand practical API communication between applications.
Develop transferable skills for building API-driven projects.
targetAudience: Aspiring JavaScript developers
Learners with basic programming knowledge seeking hands-on projects
Students interested in API integration
Developers looking to practice building mini-applications

resources.title: Learn Next.js
resources.description: Unlock the full potential of Next.js in this comprehensive course designed for web developers aiming to elevate their applications. Explore server-side and client-side rendering, dynamic routing, and Next.js’s powerful optimization. With hands-on lessons on Next.js’s file-based routing system, data fetching, and optimization, you’ll gain the skills to create high-performing, scalable, and SEO-friendly web applications. Whether you’re transitioning from React or starting fresh, this course offers the insights to leverage Next.js to its fullest.
learningObjectives: Utilize Next.js for advanced server and client-side rendering
Implement dynamic routing and navigation with Next.js Router
Optimize web apps using Next.js optimization techniques
targetAudience: Intermediate web developers familiar with JavaScript and React
Developers aiming to build scalable, high‑performance web applications
Learners seeking to master Next.js features like routing and data fetching
Frontend engineers expanding into full‑stack React frameworks
Codecademy users ready for advanced web development challenges

resources.title: Certified Information Systems Security Professional CISSP
resources.description: Prepare for the CISSP certification with a structured journey covering all eight core domains of information security. Gain essential knowledge in risk management, network security, IAM, and more, with curated resources designed to guide your study and boost readiness for this globally recognized professional exam.
learningObjectives: Master the eight CISSP domains, including security and risk management, asset security, and network security.
Understand and apply security governance, policies, and compliance best practices.
Develop skills in identity and access management, security operations, and assessment/testing.
Design and evaluate secure architectures and engineering controls.
Prepare effectively for the CISSP certification exam through structured study and resources.
targetAudience: Aspiring information security professionals
IT and cybersecurity specialists seeking CISSP certification
Experienced security practitioners aiming to validate expertise
Professionals preparing for advanced security roles
Learners wanting structured guidance for the CISSP exam

resources.title: Learn Intermediate PHP
resources.description: Take your PHP skills to the next level with Intermediate PHP. This course focuses on creating dynamic web applications by leveraging databases, file handling, APIs, and more. You’ll also learn how to set up PHP on your computer using XAMPP, empowering you to build functional and interactive projects.
learningObjectives: Managing databases to store and retrieve data
Working with external APIs for dynamic applications
Performing file handling in PHP
Setting up a local PHP environment with XAMPP
targetAudience: Intermediate web developers with basic PHP experience
Learners who have completed an introductory PHP course
Developers building dynamic web applications
Programmers wanting to work with databases and APIs in PHP
Back-end developers aiming to expand backend development skills

resources.title: Learn Redux
resources.description: Learn Redux, the powerful state-management library widely used with React to handle complex data sharing between components. With a focus on predictable, reliable apps, Redux helps you manage state in an efficient and scalable way. This course will guide you from core concepts to advanced tools, empowering you to create better React applications.
learningObjectives: Learn core Redux concepts: reducers, stores, actions
Use Redux Toolkit, React Redux, Redux Thunk
Manage state in complex React apps
Build scalable, predictable applications with Redux
targetAudience: Intermediate JavaScript and React developers wanting to manage application state with Redux
Frontend engineers who need predictable, scalable state management in React apps
Developers aiming to enhance React applications with Redux Toolkit and middleware
Learners prepared with JavaScript and React fundamentals seeking practical Redux skills
Software developers building real-world projects and state‑driven interfaces

resources.title: React Native Meta
resources.description: Fundamentals of React Native app development: build cross‑platform mobile UIs, core components, navigation, and interactivity with hands‑on modules and projects, earning a shareable certificate upon completion.
learningObjectives: Build single-page React Native apps using core components like View, Text, and StyleSheet
Style components and layouts effectively using React Native styling methods
Create large, performant lists with FlatList and SectionList components
Configure and handle user inputs with TextInput components
Implement interactive elements using Pressable and other UI components
Set up navigation and transition between screens using React Navigation
Gain hands-on experience with React, JSX, and mobile development tools like Expo and Visual Studio Code
Prepare for a career in cross-platform mobile app development
targetAudience: Aspiring mobile app developers
Web developers looking to transition to mobile development
Students and professionals interested in cross-platform app development
Beginner to intermediate programmers seeking hands-on React Native experience
Developers aiming to build interactive and responsive mobile applications

topics: Introduction to React Native basics and setup
Building single‑page applications with View, Text, StyleSheet
Understanding core components and expo tooling

sections.title: Lists & User Inputs

resources.title: Android App Development Full Course with PRACTICAL ( Beginners to Advanced )
resources.description: A comprehensive Android app development video course covering fundamentals to advanced topics like UI design, background services, notifications, app architecture, performance optimization, and publishing real apps with Android Studio through practical, step‑by‑step projects and examples.
learningObjectives: Set up Android Studio and configure the development environment for building Android apps
Understand core Android components such as Activities, Fragments, and Intents
Design user interfaces using layouts, UI widgets, and XML
Write Android app logic using Java and/or Kotlin programming languages
Work with data storage options like SQLite and shared preferences
Integrate networking and APIs, parsing JSON responses
Debug, test, and optimize Android applications for performance
Use practical, hands‑on projects to build real Android applications
targetAudience: Aspiring Android developers
Beginner to intermediate programmers interested in mobile app development
Students and professionals looking to build real Android applications
Developers transitioning from other programming languages to Kotlin
Software engineers seeking hands-on experience with Android Studio and app deployment

sections.title: UI Design & Navigation

resources.title: Generative AI for Cybersecurity
resources.description: A hands-on IBM program teaching how to integrate generative AI into cybersecurity workflows. Learn AI models, prompting strategies, threat intelligence automation, and risk assessment while building real-world projects and a portfolio to prepare for high-demand cybersecurity roles with competitive salaries.
learningObjectives: Understand the role of generative AI in cybersecurity workflows
Differentiate between generative AI and discriminative AI
Explore real-world use cases of AI in threat detection and security operations
Learn key prompting strategies, including zero-shot and few-shot learning
Work with AI tools like IBM watsonx, Prompt Lab, Spellbook, and Dust
Enhance threat intelligence and automate User and Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA)
Summarize security reports and optimize cybersecurity playbooks using AI
Assess AI risks and vulnerabilities in cybersecurity applications
Analyze real-world case studies to understand AI-driven threat mitigation
Build a portfolio demonstrating AI-powered cybersecurity skills
targetAudience: Aspiring cybersecurity professionals
IT and security specialists looking to integrate AI into workflows
Software developers seeking to enter the cybersecurity field
Engineers aiming to enhance skills with AI-driven security tools
Students or career changers interested in AI-powered threat detection and automation

sections.title: Foundations of Generative AI
topics: Difference between generative and discriminative AI
Real‑world use cases across text, image, audio, and code
Overview of popular generative AI models and tools

sections.title: Prompt Engineering & AI Tools
topics: Principles of prompt engineering and best practices
Hands‑on use of tools like IBM watsonx, Prompt Lab, Spellbook, Dust
Creating effective prompts for cybersecurity scenarios

sections.title: AI in Cybersecurity Practices
topics: Applying generative AI to threat intelligence and analytics
Automating User and Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA)
Using AI for report summarization and playbook optimization
Real‑world case studies: phishing, malware, NLP‑based threats

sections.title: Applied Projects & Portfolio
topics: Hands‑on labs with generative AI in security workflows
Capstone or project work addressing cybersecurity use cases
Assessment of AI risks and mitigation strategies
Building a showcase portfolio for potential employers

sections.title: Review & Mastery
topics: Consolidation of key concepts and techniques
Reflection on ethical considerations and security risks
Preparation for certification or career readiness

resources.title: Ethereum Developer Bootcamp
resources.description: A comprehensive Ethereum Developer Bootcamp teaching EVM fundamentals, cryptography, Solidity smart contracts, blockchain data structures, and full dApp development with interactive coding challenges, projects, and community support to prepare learners for web3 engineering roles.

Develop decentralized applications (dApps) on Ethereum
Explore blockchain data structures, transactions, and cryptography
Interact with Ethereum using web3.js and Alchemy tools
Deploy and test smart contracts on testnets
Build end-to-end blockchain projects and hands-on exercises

Web developers seeking to transition to decentralized applications

Develop and deploy smart contracts on Ethereum-compatible blockchains
Write secure and efficient Solidity code following best practices
Test contracts using Foundry and other development tools
Build real-world projects such as voting dApps and escrow contracts
Debug, audit, and optimize smart contracts for security and performance
Integrate smart contracts with front-end applications using web3 libraries
targetAudience: Intermediate blockchain developers
Ethereum developers seeking to deepen Solidity skills
Programmers familiar with smart contracts and dApp development
Web3 developers looking to build secure and efficient contracts
